Description: Fragment of a seal-impression, the fine brown Nile clay has some mica inclusions and was hardened after excavation. The rear shows an uneven area, slightly concave, maybe from a leather bag or similar. In the break several turned string impressions. On the top several finger impressions and about a third of an oval scarab-like seal-impression with a very clear cut of a horizontal cartouche of Mn-kheper-R'. To the right of it what looks like a lotus flower. On top of this a larger bent sign, maybe a boat. Rest broken off.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Amara West (Nubia), E14.7 temple magazine
Acquisition notes: Formerly housed by the Birmingham Museum and Art Gallery and the EES London.
